definition: to cover/to encase/cover/sheath/to overlap/to interleave/to model after/to copy/formula/harness/loop of rope/(fig.) to fish for/to obtain slyly/classifier for sets, collections/bend (of a river or mountain range, in place names)/tau (Greek letter Ττ)

sentences.english: Each of the two legs for sowing can be arbitrarily disassembled to be applicable for interplant spot sowing.
sentences.chinese: 两条播种腿可任意取下一条，以适用套种点播。

sentences.english: Peanut intercropped with medicinal plants could regulate soil microbial community effectively.
sentences.chinese: 药用植物和花生套种可以有效调节土壤微生物区系。

sentences.english: In addition, higher economy benefit was also achieved from the interplantation of vegetable in new tea garden.
sentences.chinese: 新植茶园间套种蔬菜也有较高的经济效益。

sentences.english: It is also good for maize interplanting operation, as well as seedlings growth.
sentences.chinese: 对玉米套种作业和幼苗生长也有好处。

sentences.english: Cultural techniques of interplanting pumpkin in young plum garden were summarized in this paper.
sentences.chinese: 简要介绍了在幼龄梅园套种南瓜的栽培技术。

definition: test planting/crop grown on a trial basis
rotation of crops (to preserve fertility of soil)
